comment.author: 16489083@N05
comment._content:
Wonderful... thanks for sharing this image!!!
"Locomotive B124 was built for Coras Iompair Éireann (CIE),
 the Irish State owned transport company by General Motors 
at their premises at La Grange, Illinois, USA in 1960."
Thanks for the link Seuss... wish things were still this booming
here in the USA... praying for a better day for both our countries!!!
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment._content: Oh boy, I love trains! Good to learn about the locos themselves. Any further images of Irish railways are much appreciated!

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: Great capture by O'Dea, for those wondering this is what the original livery looked like in colour. I was wondering when we get to the 24th of Feb could you upload the following of O'Dea's ref: 23/62, as I think it shows the same locos running bonnet first before it was discontinued for safety reasons following an accident!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Yours to command [http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] ! I'll just need to have a look at it, but as long as it's up to O'Dea's usual high standard, up it goes... And thanks for asking, I like taking requests!  :D
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] That would great thanks, and don't worry I won't be a pester for certain photos! If you get a chance you might consider submitting his photos to the Irish Railways group on Flickr.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/flyingsnail] Joined the group, and submitted first photo!
O'Dea 23/62 is a good shot, but it's B126 (looks exactly the same as B124 to the uninitiated, i.e. me), so it's pencilled in for 24 February Pic of the Day... And you're not pestering, if there's something you'd like to see, chances are others will too  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
